definition: to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]

sentences.english: Even when I climbed carefully into my hammock, about 30 would zip under the net.
sentences.chinese: 即使当我小心爬进我的吊床时，我仍被叮了约30次。

sentences.english: Is it money-saving or life-risking to sleep on the hammock under the container-truck?
sentences.chinese: 女子在货柜车底挂吊床睡觉，省钱还是玩命？

sentences.english: Inthe back yard, someone had tied one end of a hammock to a tree.
sentences.chinese: 有人在后院的树上挂起了吊床。

sentences.english: A hammock swings between the two trees.
sentences.chinese: 在那两棵树中间挂着一个吊床。

sentences.english: An empty hammock hangs between two lovely trees.
sentences.chinese: 空吊床悬在两棵美丽的树间。

sentences.english: Another piece of fabric is placed along the bottom, creating a hammock-style chair.
sentences.chinese: 另一块织物放在作为底部，形成一个吊床式座椅。

sentences.english: He looked upwards, and saw that the dwarf was smoking in his hammock.
sentences.chinese: 他抬头向上一望，看到矮子正在吊床里喷云吐雾。

sentences.english: Each individual bungalow has a king-size bed, walk-in wardrobe and hammock on the veranda.
sentences.chinese: 每个小屋都有一张巨大的床和衣橱，阳台还安有吊床。

sentences.english: This is a hammock station. You can dangle to wait for the arrival of public transportation.
sentences.chinese: 吊床车站，你可以晃晃悠悠地等待公交的到来。

sentences.english: It has skylights, a hammock, and unparalleled views in every direction.
sentences.chinese: 房间有天窗，吊床，以及全方位的美景。

sentences.english: This beach is furnished with loungers, parasols, hammocks, showers and a beach bar.
sentences.chinese: 海滩配有椅，太阳伞，吊床，淋浴和海滩酒吧。

sentences.english: Hang a hammock; lie in it.
sentences.chinese: 挂上一个吊床，然后躺在里面。
“我想我是吊床反对者，”莎拉说。

definition: swing (seat hung from a frame or branch)
